etymology.description: 食(食) (shí, "eat"; "meal") + 物(物) (wù, "thing") together form the compound "food."
etymology.interpretation: The combination of 食(食) (shí, "eat") and 物(物) (wù, "thing") refers to anything that is eaten, thus aptly describing "food."

examples.chinese: 那家餐厅的食物很美味(那家餐廳的食物很美味)。
examples.pinyin: Nà jiā cāntīng de shíwù hěn měiwèi.
examples.english: The food at that restaurant is delicious.

examples.chinese: 冰箱里有很多食物(冰箱裏有很多食物)。
examples.pinyin: Bīngxiāng lǐ yǒu hěn duō shíwù.
examples.english: There is a lot of food in the refrigerator.

examples.chinese: 他们整理了食物(他們整理了食物)，以备明天的聚会(以備明天的聚會)。
examples.pinyin: Tāmen zhěnglǐ le shíwù, yǐ bèi míngtiān de jùhuì.
examples.english: They organized the food to prepare for tomorrow's gathering.
